page.title: 08Churches in our Area.
page.content: St.Marys Church Ashbury was built in the 12th century but there was probably an earlier church on the same site. There are 7 areas in the church three are small areas but the rest are big There is also a sunday school.The baptisim font is 1 metre high and about 1 metre across.It is on the right side you can see it when you walk into the church.The church is built of chalk and stone.There are ten people in the choir three adults and 7 children.There are 13 windows and also 3 doors.The church is 39 metres long and 14 across.On sunday the service starts at 10.30 and finish at 11.30. The Methodist church is called Ashbury Partridge Memorial Church.It is made of concrete blocks rendered with pebbledash and the base is brick.The stone on the church was laid by Mrs A. Partridge on the 5th April 1926.There
